intro: Pycreus flavescens subsp. tanaensis, commonly known as the Tanaensis pycreus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that typically display vibrant colors. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
